text: People Generally Do Not Know What is Best for Them
A good name \add is\add* better than precious ointment,
and the day of death \add is better\add* than the day of one’s birth.
Better to go to the house of mourning
than to go to the house of feasting,
for \add death is\add* the end of every person,
and the living should take \add it\add* to his heart.
Sorrow \add is\add* better than laughter,
for by sadness of countenance the heart is made good.
The heart of the wise \add is\add* in the house of mourning,
but the heart of fools \add is\add* in the house of mirth.
Better to listen to \add the\add* rebuke of \add the\add* wise
than for a man to listen to \add the\add* song of fools.
Like the sound of thorns under a pot,
so also the laughter of fools.
This also \add is\add* vanity!
Wisdom—Although Vulnerable—is Beneficial
Surely oppression makes a fool of the wise,
and a bribe corrupts the heart.
The end of a matter \add is\add* better than its beginning;
⸤better to be slow to anger than hot-headed⸥.\f + \fr 7:8 \ft Literally “\fq one who is \ft long of spirit \fq is \ft better than \fq one who is \ft high of spirit” \f*
Do not be quick in your spirit to anger,
for anger lodges in the bosom of fools.
Do not say, “Why were the former days better than these?”
For \add it is\add* not from wisdom \add that\add* you ask this.
Wisdom \add is\add* good with an inheritance;
⸤it benefits the living⸥.\f + \fr 7:11 \ft Literally “to those who see the sun” \f*
⸤For wisdom offers protection like money offers protection⸥.\f + \fr 7:12 \ft Literally “For in the shade of wisdom \fq is \ft the shade of money” \f*
But knowledge \add has\add* an advantage—wisdom restores life to its possessor.
Humans Must Accept God’s Will and Make the Best of It
Consider the work of God.
For who is able to make straight what he made crooked?
In the day of prosperity, rejoice!
But in the day of adversity, consider!
For God made one in place of another
so that mortals cannot find out what will happen ⸤in the future⸥.\f + \fr 7:14 \ft Literally “after him” \f*
The Law of Retribution Does Not Always Work—but It Does Sometimes
I have seen all these things in my vain life:
Sometimes a righteous man perishes in \add spite of\add* his righteousness,
and sometimes a wicked man lives a long life in \add spite of\add* his evil.
Do not be excessively\f + \fr 7:16 \ft Or “abundantly” \f* righteous,
and do not act excessively wise, lest you destroy yourself.
Do not act excessively wicked,
and do not be a fool, lest you die before your time.
\add It is\add* good to take hold of the one and also must not let go of the other;
for whoever fears God will hold both of them secure.
Wisdom is Valuable, but No One is Completely Righteous
Wisdom gives more strength to the wise
than ten rulers who are in the city.
Surely there is no one righteous on the earth
who \add continually\add* does good and never sins.
Do not pay attention to everything people say,
lest you hear your own servant curse you.
For your heart knows
that you also have cursed others many times.
Absolute Wisdom is Unattainable
All this I have tested with wisdom. I said, “I will be wise!” but ⸤it was beyond my grasp⸥.\f + \fr 7:23 \ft Literally “it \fq was \ft far from me” \f*
⸤Whatever is—it is far beyond comprehension⸥.\f + \fr 7:24 \ft Literally “That which is—it \fq is \ft far and deep deep” \f* Who can discover it?
I set my mind to try to seek wisdom and the plan, and to know that wickedness \add is\add* foolishness and that folly \add is\add* delusion.

I myself found \add that\add* more bitter than death \add is\add* the woman who \add is\add* a trap, whose heart \add is\add* a snare, and whose hands \add are\add* bonds. The one who pleases God escapes from her, but the sinner is caught by her.
“Look! I found this,” said the Teacher,\f + \fr 7:27 \ft Hebrew “Qohelet” \f* “while trying to find how the plan fits together.
What my heart sought, I did not find. Although I found one righteous man among one thousand, I did not find one \add upright\add* woman among all these.
Look! This alone I found: God made mankind upright, but they have devised many schemes.”
